Race.SpecificTitle: Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District -- $100 Parcel Fee - CC - 5 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy annually a renewal of the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District parcel fee on each improved parcel of land in the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District (the "District"), in the amount of and not exceeding one hundred dollars ($100), for a period of and not exceeding five (5) years, beginning January 1, 2016 and ending December 31, 2020, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $170,000 annually, to be used exclusively for promoting quality of life initiatives and encouraging the beautification and overall benefit in the District as determined by the District's Board of Commissioners, except a 1% City collection fee, and if used for additional services, such services shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of services provided by the city, the state, or other political subdivisions?

Race.SpecificTitle: Algiers Levee District -- 6.35 Mills - BOC - 30 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Algiers Levee District (the "District") be authorized to levy and collect annually a special tax of 6.35 mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (the "Tax") (an estimated $1,224,000 reasonably expected at the time to be collected for an entire year) for a period of thirty years beginning with the year 2016, and ending with the year 2045, said Tax to represent a twenty-eight hundredths (0.28) mills increase over the 6.07 mills authorized to be levied through the year 2015 pursuant to an election held on November 19, 1983; and shall the revenues or proceeds of 6.35 mills of the Tax hereafter received from the authorization of the Tax be dedicated and used for the purpose of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection and for all other purposes incidental thereto, including payments required in connection with debt obligations incurred for any of the above described capital purposes, as well as a portion of the operation and maintenance of the Gulf Intracoastal Waterway - West Closure Complex, which is part of Louisiana's comprehensive integrated coastal protection plan and from which the jurisdiction of the Algiers Levee District derives benefit?
